metadata.Title: CVE-2023-28755 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A ReDoS issue was discovered in the URI component through 0.12.0 in Ruby through 3.2.1. The URI parser mishandles invalid URLs that have specific characters. It causes an increase in execution time for parsing strings to URI objects. The fixed versions are 0.12.1, 0.11.1, 0.10.2 and 0.10.0.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28755` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby3.0 - 3.0.4-7ubuntu0.2
ruby3.0 - 3.0.4-7ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

libruby3.1 - 3.1.2-2ubuntu0.22.10.1
ruby3.1 - 3.1.2-2ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> ruby{1.9.1,2.0,2.3} and jruby ship an embedded rubygems.

criterions.comment: ruby3.0 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.4-7ubuntu0.2').
ruby3.1 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-2ubuntu0.22.10.1').
rubygems package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
